comments.body: It kinda made me add this after complaining about no return statement. It wouldn't even let me use just `return`. Is this a known issue/attribute of `mypy`?

This is mypa's expected behavior. If the function exits without calling `return`, Python implicitly returns None. Mypy requires us to be implicit in this case.

 > Explicit is better than implicit.

https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0020/

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +246,250 @@            # for later use (like retrieving an artifact)
            return build_info['url']
        return None

comments.body: Here's where we preserve the same behavior for `self.build_job` by passing `self.parameters` as the "local" parameters in the function.
